isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 5000 9100 9200 9400 9900 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - 5000, 5000i, 9000, 9000i - DIAGNOSTICS

svcsubsecinfo.para: Refer to Circuit Diagram Book CTS-5119V, CTS-5119W, CTS-5273V, CTS-5273W or S08210 in GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
The Speedometer/Tachometer module performs electronic gauge circuit diagnostics(speedometer, tachometer, oil pressure, water temperature, fuel and voltmeter) and gauge sensor diagnostics.

The Speedometer/Tachometer module does not checkthe standard 3-pin electrical gauges, circuits or senders. The TROUBLESHOOTING Section contains step-by-step fault trees to troubleshoot the electronic gauges and the standard electrical gauges.

The Speedometer/Tachometer module performs self-diagnostics at power up for the gauge circuits and sensors. The Speedometer/Tachometer module uses gauge pointer movement and the alarm to communicate the faults to the driver or service technician. The alarm and pointer movements used to communicate conditions are:

item.para: At power up if all six gauge pointers make one full sweep, this indicates all circuits are working properly.
Speedometer and Tachometer pointer "less than full sweep" movements are used in the GAUGE CIRCUIT TROUBLESHOOTING.
In SENSOR FAULT DIAGNOSTICS, faults are noted by the individual gauges pointing to the six o'clock position (down). The alarm will also sound three long beeps.

step1.para: When the key is turned ON, the pointers will make one full sweep (through the entire range of each gauge, 0-3500 rpm & 0-85 mph) indicating that all of the electronic gauge circuits are working properly.

step2.para: If one or more of the gauge pointers goes to the 6 o'clock position and the alarm sounds three long beeps, go to SENSOR FAULT DIAGNOSTICS.
If one or more of the gauges does not go through the full range, but is not at a 6 o'clock position, go to GAUGE CIRCUIT TROUBLESHOOTING.

step1.para: If the speedometer and tachometer pointers sweep in unison, and the tachometer sweeps three times between 0 and 500 rpm while the speedometer sweeps between 0 and 14 mph, replace the Speedometer/Tachometer module.

If the speedometer and tachometer pointers sweep in unison, and the tachometer sweeps three times between 0 and 1000 rpm while the speedometer sweeps between 0 and 25 mph, replace the Speedometer/Tachometer module.

If the speedometer and tachometer pointers sweep in unison, and the tachometer sweeps three times between 0 and 1500 rpm while the speedometer sweeps between 0 and 38 mph, this indicates the J1708 data link circuits may be defective. Go to SUSPECT DATA LINK CIRCUITS.

If the speedometer and tachometer pointers sweep in unison, and the tachometer sweeps three times between 0 and 2000 rpm while the speedometer sweeps between 0 and 50 mph, the odometer drive circuit is bad. Replace the Speedometer/Tachometer module.

If the speedometer and tachometer pointers sweep in unison, and the tachometer sweeps between 0 and 2500 rpm while the speedometer sweeps between 0 and 65 mph, the odometer or the circuit is open or disconnected. Check connections. If connections are good, replace the Speedometer/Tachometer module which contains the odometer.
